In Document english_master_glossary_02_2011.pdf in page 48: NON COMPOS MENTIS - Not of sound mind; insane. NON EST (INVENTUS) - Translated: "not to be found"; a sheriff's return of process when service is not made because the person to be served was not found. NON OBSTANTE VERDICTO (N.O.V.) - Notwithstanding the verdict. A verdict entered by the judge contrary to a jury's verdict. NUNC PRO TUNC -A legal phrase applied to acts which are allowed after the time when they should be done, with a retroactive effect. PARENS PATRIAE The doctrine under which the court protects the interests of a juvenile. New user question: Bitte erkl'ren sie mir PARENS PATRIAE
llm_response: "PARENS PATRIAE" is a legal doctrine where the court acts as a protector of the interests of a juvenile. For example, if a child is in a situation where their legal guardian is unable to fulfill their responsibilities, the court may step in as the "parens patriae" to ensure the well-being and protection of the child.
